author: Eduardo Sánchez
title: Para resolver crónicos problemas de suministro, reemplazaron 85 metros de un acueducto
text:
Con el fin de procurar “una solución definitiva” a un problema que se había tornado crónico en el acueducto principal que abastece a los populosos barrios Sargento Cabral y Alto Comedero, en la zona sur de la capital jujeña, un equipo dispuesto por la empresa estatal Agua Potable de Jujuy concretó un operativo de gran envergadura técnica que requirió el trabajo de más de treinta personas con maquinarias pesadas e instrumental específico para la tarea.
EFICAZ OPERATIVO EN TIEMPO RECORD
En efecto, en muy pocas horas y con la ventaja de no haber tenido que interrumpir la prestación del servicio a los usuarios, el equipo conformado por personal de Agua Potable de Jujuy y una contratista especializada llevó adelante un operativo que consistió en reemplazar un tramo de caño de acero de 85 metros de longitud y 450 mm de diámetro, localizado en el Loteo San Pablo. En ese punto se encuentra el nexo que abastece a la planta potabilizadora del barrio Sargento Cabral, cuya función es alimentar a ese sector y algunas zonas del extenso barrio Alto Comedero.
“La intervención consistió en el retiro del tramo deteriorado, seguido de la colocación del nuevo ducto y su conexión con juntas diseñadas específicamente para este tipo de trabajos de alta complejidad. Además, se incorporó una válvula de aire para proteger el sistema de posibles sobrepresiones y garantizar su correcto funcionamiento”, detalló un vocero de la empresa estatal.
De acuerdo a lo planificado, esta obra permite aplicar un adecuado aumento de presión en el volumen de agua producido en la planta potabilizadora de Alto Reyes y que se transporta por el ducto en dirección a la cisterna “Sargento Cabral”, ubicada en el barrio homónimo.
PRUEBAS Y FUNCIONAMIENTO EXITOSO
El reporte oficial da cuenta que realizado el reemplazo del tramo, los técnicos efectuaron en el acueducto las pruebas hidráulicas correspondientes para verificar el correcto funcionamiento del nexo, las cuales resultaron exitosas.
De esa manera el tramo quedó habilitado con la mejora que permite “el incremento de caudal y presión para la zona”, lo que en la práctica es “un traslado óptimo y veloz del recurso vital” que llega a los hogares y demás clientes.

title: Newmont Completes $20 Million Global Community Support Fund, Partnering with Communities for Greater Resilience Post-Pandemic | Financial Post
text: Newmont Completes $20 Million Global Community Support Fund, Partnering with Communities for Greater Resilience Post-Pandemic Article content [tap here to see other videos from our team](/video-centre/). Newmont Completes $20 Million Global Community Support Fund, Partnering with Communities for Greater Resilience Post-Pandemic Back to video Global Community Support Fund demonstrates commitment to social responsibility and strengthening community engagement DENVER — Newmont Corporation (NYSE: NEM, TSX: NGT, ASX: NEM, PNGX: NEM) proudly announces the successful completion of the $20 million Global Community Support Fund (the Fund), established in April 2020 in response to the unprecedented challenges posed by the global pandemic. The objective of this fund was to provide critical financial resources to host communities where Newmont operates, targeting funds to address immediate impacts of the global pandemic while catalyzing long-term resiliency and future community development. “After almost four years since its launch, we are pleased to announce the successful closure of the Global Community Support Fund, which reflects our ongoing commitment to partnering with the communities where we operate,” said Suzy Retallack, Chief Safety and Sustainability Officer at Newmont. “The Fund’s impact has been far-reaching, contributing to the collective efforts of communities to overcome the challenges posed by the pandemic and innovate for greater resilience in the future.” Over the past 3.5 years, Newmont has partnered with more than 420 local governments, medical institutions, charities, and non-governmental organizations to strategically allocate funds effectively. The $20 million Fund has been instrumental in supporting a wide range of initiatives, focused on health, food security and economic resilience: - $1.4 million donated to the Regional Hospital of Cajamarca, providing ventilators, incubators, monitoring equipment, COVID-19 tests and personal protective equipment (PPE). - $500,000 donation matched by the Colorado Health Foundation resulting in a $1 million total donation to the Colorado Community Support Fund to support community health and prevention for underserved populations in the state. - $300,000 donated to the American Red Cross Global Disaster Preparedness Center to support research and local-level grants for emergency response community resilience. - $304,000 donated to the Cree Trappers’ Association in Quebec to provide food security to vulnerable people and employment for traditional harvesters in the nine communities of Eeyou Istchee. - $734,000 donated to the Kumasi Centre for Collaborative Research in Ghana to establish two new laboratories in the host communities of Ahafo and Akyem along with COVID-19 tests and testing equipment to expand their testing capacity for COVID-19 and other infectious diseases. - $968,000 donated to Suriname’s Ministry of Health to launch the Recovery and Resilience Project in partnership with Crown Agents to strengthen Suriname’s health system, reduce non-communicable diseases (NCDs) and COVID-19 burdens, and enhance emergency response capabilities. “As part of our commitment to addressing the challenges posed by non-communicable diseases (NCDs) and the impact of COVID-19 in Suriname, Crown Agents, the Ministry of Health and Newmont formed an impactful partnership on the Recovery and Resilience Project. Together, we worked to strengthen Suriname’s health system, alleviate the burden of NCDs and COVID-19, and enhance emergency response capabilities,” says Sarah Hepworth, Chief Programmes Officer at Crown Agents. “Our focus on strengthening NCD services, promoting vaccination uptake, and addressing healthcare worker hesitancy underscores our dedication to improving the well-being of the people of Suriname. Crown Agents is proud to collaborate with Newmont and the Ministry of Health to contribute to the health and resilience of Suriname.” Newmont remains committed to its core values of safety, sustainability, and responsibility, and the successful implementation of the Global Community Support Fund underpins the company’s purpose to create value and improve lives through sustainable and responsible mining. About Newmont Newmont is the world’s leading gold company and a producer of copper, zinc, lead, and silver. The company’s world-class portfolio of assets, prospects and talent is anchored in favorable mining jurisdictions in Africa, Australia, Latin America & Caribbean, North America, and Papua New Guinea. Newmont is the only gold producer listed in the S&P 500 Index and is widely recognized for its principled environmental, social, and governance practices. Newmont is an industry leader in value creation, supported by robust safety standards, superior execution, and technical expertise. Founded in 1921, the company has been publicly traded since 1925. At Newmont, our purpose is to create value and improve lives through sustainable and responsible mining. To learn more about Newmont’s sustainability strategy and initiatives, go to www.newmont.com . author: Alessandra Arachi
title: Armi ai 16 enni e calendario ampliato La «nuova» caccia secondo FdI
text:
Le doppiette ai sedicenni, il calendario della caccia più lungo e più lunghe anche le giornate per dare la caccia agli animali, protratte oltre il tramonto. Il disegno di legge di Fratelli d’Italia punta a modificare l’attuale legge (la 157 del ’92) in senso permissivo e fa infuriare le associazioni ambientaliste. «Oltre a tutte le altre cose negative, con questa legge finiremmo sotto infrazione della commissione europea, la terza infrazione sempre in questo campo», dice Domenico Aiello responsabile legale del Wwf, spiegando che «queste infrazioni ci costano otto mila euro al giorno».
Armi ai 16 enni e calendario ampliato La «nuova» caccia secondo FdI
Il sottosegretario La Pietra: ddl a nome del governo. Brambilla: in Parlamento non passerà
Il testo del disegno di legge è stato voluto tutto da FdI, lo ha scritto Sergio Berlato, eurodeputato, ed è praticamente una fotocopia di quello presentato poco più di un anno fa. Lo ha depositato in Senato Bartolomeo Amidei e il sottosegretario all’Agricoltura Patrizio La Pietra ha garantito che del testo il Senato se ne occuperà subito dopo la legge del Bilancio, parlando «a nome del governo», ovvero del suo ministro, Francesco Lollobrigida, noto per la sua passione verso la caccia.
Sono diciassette gli articoli che compongono il testo e sono tutti mirati a facilitare l’attività venatoria. Estende le specie cacciabili inserendo uccelli e mammiferi oggi protetti; riduce l’estensione delle aree protette; amplia le possibilità dei cacciatori di accedere ai terreni privati; riduce i divieti vigenti, consentendo ad esempio di cacciare da veicoli e natanti. Ma, soprattutto, limita fortemente il controllo scientifico dell’Ispra. Aggiunge Domenico Aiello: «Sono norme che violano palesemente la Costituzione che nel 2022 è stata modificata all’articolo 9 inserendo la tutela dell’ambiente, la biodiversità, gli ecosistemi».
La prima a scagliarsi contro il disegno di legge è Michela Vittoria Brambilla, deputata di Noi moderati e fondatrice della Leidaa: «In qualità di presidente della commissione bicamerale per l’infanzia e l’adolescenza non posso che esprimere forte preoccupazione per la possibilità di dare i fucili in mano ai minori. Sono certa che il Parlamento non approverà una simile legge». Brambilla è preoccupata anche per «l’estensione del calendario venatorio, in termini di giornata e di orario. La caccia è pericolosa non soltanto per gli animali e l’ambiente ma anche per i cittadini che non possono passeggiare sicuri».
L’Enpa, l’Ente nazionale della protezione animali non ha dubbi: «Il via libera alle armi per i minorenni è la punta dell’iceberg di un inaccettabile progetto ammazza-animali, un vero colpo di Stato contro la fauna selvatica. Siamo di fronte a una dichiarazione di guerra. Questo disegno di legge non è né una boutade né una iniziativa isolata, ma rientra in un preciso disegno strategico perseguito fin dall’insediamento dell’attuale governo: fare carta straccia delle nostre normative ambientali»
Dall’opposizione praticamente tutti contestano il permesso del fucile ai sedicenni. Dal Pd si leva la voce di Walter Verini: «Un senatore di FdI che propone di dare il fucile ai sedicenni. Sembra incredibile ma è vero, questa destra ha un concetto di sicurezza da Far west, vuole più armi in giro e quindi più rischi per la sicurezza dei cittadini». Sulla stessa linea Riccardo Magi di +Europa: «Ma veramente il governo vuole rendere più facile la circolazione delle armi con la scusa della caccia? Ma veramente il governo vuole togliere vincoli all’attività venatoria? Siamo alla follia di una destra pistolera».
Angelo Bonelli, leader dei Verdi: «La proposta di permettere l’uso dei fucili già a sedici anni e di estendere considerevolmente la stagione di caccia, con la possibilità di attività venatorie nelle aree protette e demaniali, rappresenta un grave rischio per l’equilibrio ecologico e la biodiversità. Tutto ciò serve solo a dare forza all’industria delle armi».

author: ArcaMax Publishing, Inc.
title: Fani Willis says she's been 'attacked and oversexualized' | Political News | ArcaMax Publishing
text:
ATLANTA — Fulton County District Attorney Fani Willis on Thursday defended Black women, saying they are often the victims of violence and are the most unprotected members of society.
Speaking to a congregation at Turner Chapel AME Church in Marietta, Willis cited her own experience of being “attacked and oversexualized” as a Black woman doing her job. The prosecutor also condemned the media for failing to address the persistent violence.
“That same media will jump at the morsel of a chance to tear a sister down,” she said.
Willis has been at the center of a media firestorm since early this year, when her romantic relationship with Nathan Wade, the outside lawyer she hired to lead the Donald Trump election subversion case, became the focus of an attempt to oust her. A judge said Willis could stay on the Trump case, but Wade must resign.
That decision is being considered by the Georgia Court of Appeals. On Wednesday, Willis’ office asked the court to dismiss the appeal.
Wade attended Willis’ speech Thursday sitting alone in a pew in the rear of the church. The night before, CNN aired an interview with Wade in which he denied responsibility for delaying the racketeering case, saying that defense attorneys used his relationship with Willis to cause distractions.
While acknowledging that the relationship suffered from “bad timing,” Wade said he does not regret it and still considers Willis a close friend.
 In her speech Thursday, Willis also spoke about elected political officials who she said have not adhered to the principles of justice. She condemned U.S. Rep. Jim Jordan, although not by name, referring to the lawmaker as a “clown” who serves over a community riddled with poverty and crime but has done nothing to address it.
“He’s been sitting there for 17 years and passed zero laws,” she said.
Jordan, chair of the Republican-led House Judiciary Committee, has for months led efforts to discredit Willis’ investigation into the prosecution of Trump and 14 remaining co-defendants.
Willis made no mention of the Trump case, the appeal or Wade during her speech on Thursday.
In attendance, was one of her staunchest supporters, Bishop Reginald Jackson, whom Willis said she considered a mentor and true friend. Jackson, a prominent leader of the African Methodist Episcopal Church, introduced Willis on Thursday and mentioned the establishment of the Prosecuting Attorneys Qualifications Commission in Georgia.
The commission, which began operating in April, is doing nothing more than going after Black prosecutors, he said. In an op-ed in The Atlanta Journal-Constitution, Jackson also said that he was “offended” by the way defense lawyers treated Willis’s personal life.

author: Valentina Raffio
title: Cataluña extiende los avisos naranjas y amarillos por lluvias torrenciales hasta el domingo
text: El Servei Meteorològic de Cataluña ha activado decenas de avisos amarillos y naranja ante el riesgo de que la DANA que esta semana ha azotado España siga dejando lluvias torrenciales en el territorio durante los próximos días. Los pronósticos apuntan a que el temporal se seguirá extendiendo hasta como mínimo el domingo, por lo que se han activado varios avisos ante la posibilidad de que las lluvias dejen más de 100 litros por metro cuadrado en algunos puntos del litoral catalán. Por el momento, las zonas con más riesgo se concentran en el extremo sur, incluyendo el Tarragonès, el Baix Camp, el Priorat, Ribera d'Ebre, Terra Alta, Baix Ebre y Montsià. En Barcelona, se ha activado un aviso amarillo para viernes, sábado y domingo. Este viernes hay siete comarcas catalanas en alerta naranja por el paso de esta DANA. En el Montsià, Baix Ebre y Terra Alta, hay activo un aviso naranja por acumulación de lluvias en tanto que podrían superarse los 100 litros por metro cuadrado a lo largo de la jornada. También destaca otra alerta naranja por intensidad de las lluvias en toda la zona (desde el Tarragonès hasta el Baix Camp, el Priorat, Ribera d'Ebre), dado que entre este mediodía y la tarde podrían producirse descargas de hasta 40 litros en tan solo 30 minutos. En todas estas zonas, las autoridades piden a los residentes extremar las precauciones durante la jornada de este viernes. Este viernes también hay 14 comarcas más en alerta amarilla: el Barcelonès, Baix Llobregat, Vallès Occidental, Garraf, Alt Penedès, Anoia, Alt Camp, Baix Penedès, Conca de Barberà, Segarra, Urgell, Garrigues, Pla d'Urgell y Segrià. El aviso se extiende para toda la jornada del viernes y, en varios casos, también de cara al sábado. En estos puntos se esperan precipitaciones abundantes que en algunos casos podrían adquirir un carácter torrencial. Según datos de la Agencia Estatal de Meteorología, en el litoral y prelitoral de Barcelona se podrían registrar acumulaciones de hasta 20 litros por metro cuadrado en una hora. En el conjunto de España, este viernes hay cinco comunidades autónomas en alerta por el paso de la DANA y al menos un aviso rojo activado en el litoral de Huelva, donde se podrían dar acumulaciones de más de 140 litros por metro cuadrado en tan solo unas horas. En localidades como Cartaya ya se han acumulado más de 117 litros por metro cuadrado en menos de tres horas, de los cuales 70 en un hora. También se están registrando importantes trombas marinas asociadas a este evento. Los pronósticos sobre la evolución de esta DANA aún son inciertos pero, según los modelos más actualizados, todo apunta a que el temporal seguirá abriéndose paso durante el fin de semana. El domingo, de hecho, el Servei Meteorològic de Cataluña ha activado un aviso amarillo en todo el litoral y prelitoral catalán, desde el Alt Empordà hasta les Terres de l'Ebre, por intensidad de lluvias. Para entonces hay casi una veintena de comarcas en aviso amarillo y tres más, situadas en el extremo sur, en aviso naranja.

author: @indiatoday
title: Aurora lights up Leh skies as geomagnetic storm hits Earth
text:
Skies in Leh, Ladakh were lit up by a rare aurora borealis due to a strong geomagnetic storm that reached Earth on Thursday.
Listen to Story
Live TV
Share Advertisement Northern lights visible in Leh due to solar storm. (X/@dorje1974) India Today Science Desk
New Delhi, UPDATED: Oct 11, 2024 10:50 IST In Short Auroras lit up Leh's sky due to a severe geomagnetic storm. The storm was caused by a powerful CME from an X1.8 solar flare. Auroras were visible as far south as Alabama in the US. A spectacular display of auroras lit up the skies over Leh, India, as a severe geomagnetic storm struck Earth on October 10, 2024.
The auroras were captured at India’s highest observatory in Hanle.
This event was triggered by a powerful coronal mass ejection (CME) from the Sun , which reached Earth earlier today. The CME originated from an X1.8 solar flare that occurred on October 9, and it travelled at speeds exceeding 1.5 million miles per hour. View this post on Instagram A post shared by Dorje Angchuk (@dorje_nyrchung)
advertisement The National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) classified the geomagnetic storm as G4, indicating severe conditions that could disrupt power grids and satellite operations.
Such storms can cause auroras to be visible much further south than usual, with reports suggesting sightings as far south as Alabama and northern California in the United States. FINALLY got to see the #northernlights ! I never thought I’d be able to see them from my light polluted backyard. But it was absolutely incredible! #nepa pic.twitter.com/vYmZp12WTp — Colleen Joyce (@C_Joyce3183) October 11, 2024 Photos of the #Northernlights taken just moments ago, right over my house ðèðæ
I’ve watched them numerous times right over my house and from my backyard deck âºï¸ pic.twitter.com/GDtpPooDv1 — Leon Thomas Braun (@LeonThomasBraun) October 11, 2024 Ladakh witnesses rare auroras. See pictures
In Leh, the vibrant colours of the auroras created a breathtaking spectacle against the backdrop of the night sky.
<div class='ads__container inline-story-add id ='v-indiatoday-in' > The geomagnetic storm is part of an ongoing period of heightened solar activity as the Sun approaches its solar maximum, expected to peak in 2025. What an amazing photograph of the red aurora!
It was taken at 00:04 by Dorjey Yurgyal, our Telescope Operator at the Himalayan Chandra Telescope #HCT in #Hanle #HDSR #Ladakh using his phone! @IndiaDST @asipoec @lg_ladakh @prasarbharti @Indus_SolPhy @cessi_iiserkol @dorje1974 pic.twitter.com/idYECjBd6d — IIAstrophysics (@IIABengaluru) October 10, 2024
This cycle has led to an increase in solar flares and CMEs, which are responsible for creating auroras when charged particles collide with Earth’s magnetic field.
The auroras observed in Leh were a direct result of these interactions, showcasing brilliant reds that captivated onlookers. Here is an awesome photo of the gorgeous red #Aurora from Dorje Angchuk @dorje1974 from Stakna (outside #Leh #Ladakh , 30 sec exp from phone) @ 2:45 AM! @IndiaDST @asipoec @fiddlingstars @karandi65 @lg_ladakh @utladakhtourism @doot_iia @Indus_SolPhy @cessi_iiserkol @PrinSciAdvOff pic.twitter.com/Hub9q7Urpy — IIAstrophysics (@IIABengaluru) October 10, 2024
While the visual display was stunning, scientists warned of potential disruptions caused by the storm.
High-frequency radio communications were already experiencing interference, and there were concerns about impacts on satellite navigation systems.
Power companies and aviation authorities were advised to monitor conditions closely to mitigate any adverse effects.
As residents and tourists marvelled at the celestial light show, experts emphasised the importance of understanding space weather’s impact on technology and infrastructure.
This geomagnetic event shows our Sun’s dynamic nature and its influence on life on Earth. Published By: Devika Bhattacharya Published On: Oct 11, 2024

title: Officials issue flash flood warning for parts of eastern Puerto Rico until at least 02:15 AST Nov. 1....
text: 01 Nov 2024 | 03:19 AM UTC Puerto Rico: Flash flood warning in effect for parts of eastern region until at least 02:15 AST Nov. 1 Officials issue flash flood warning for parts of eastern Puerto Rico until at least 02:15 AST Nov. 1. Disruptions possible. The US National Weather Service (NWS) has issued a flash flood warning for parts of eastern Puerto Rico until at least 02:15 Nov. 1. Affected areas include Caguas, Cayey, Cidra, Humacao, Juncos, Las Piedras, and San Lorenzo counties. Officials could amend the warning for the impacted areas and/or extend it to the surrounding regions on short notice. Sustained heavy rainfall could trigger flooding in low-lying communities near rivers, streams, and creeks. Urban flooding is also possible in developed areas with easily overwhelmed stormwater drainage systems. Sites located downstream from large reservoirs or rivers may be subject to flash flooding after relatively short periods of intense rainfall. Landslides are possible in hilly areas, especially where heavy rain has saturated the soil. Localized business disruptions may occur in low-lying areas; some businesses might not operate at full capacity because of flood damage to facilities, possible evacuations, and some employees' inability to reach work sites. Transport, electricity, and telecommunications disruptions are also possible in areas impacted by flooding. The impact area is around 35 km (22 miles) south of San Juan. Monitor local media for weather updates and related advisories. Confirm all transport reservations and business appointments before travel. Make allowances for localized travel delays and potential supply chain disruptions where flooding has been forecast. Do not drive on flooded roads. Charge battery-powered devices in the case of prolonged electricity outages.
